title: Cleveland Street Walk Route

images.title: Mick Garratt, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Guisborough Priory. View through east wall towards the Dovecote.

images.title: Mick Garratt / Cycleway, Little Waterfall Farm
images.caption: Cycleway, Little Waterfall Farm. Recently constructed cycleway on part of the old railway. Before the trackbed was a linear pond.

images.title: Mick Garratt / Nature Reserve
images.caption: Nature Reserve. Newly created wildlife pond on the site of the South Skelton Ironstone Mine with spoil tip in the background.

images.title: Mick Garratt / Cleveland Street
images.caption: Cleveland Street path and countryside view.

images.title: Mick Garratt / Boos Beck
images.caption: Boos Beck. From which the village of Boosbeck takes its name. View downstream from Boosbeck Bridge.

images.title: Philip Barker / Cleveland Street Trail near Skelton Green
images.caption: Cleveland Street Trail near Skelton Green. This photograph shows a view of the Cleveland Street Trail as it approaches its junction with Boosbeck Road (from where the picture was taken). The viewing direction was east-north-easterly - looking towards North Skelton.

images.title: Village Post Office - Loftus by Philip Barker, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Village Post Office

description: Follow the Cleveland Street Walk from Guisborough to Loftus through lovely rolling Yorkshire countryside. The path starts at the dramatic 12th century Guisborough Priory and heads east towards the coast through Slapewath, North Skelton and Skinningrove before finishing at Loftus. Highlights on the path include the 11 arch Waterfall viaduct near Spa Wood and views of Margrove Park which is just to the south of the path near Boosbeck. The path also passes a series of dismantled railway lines and the Guisborough Forest and Walkway where there's cycle trails, walking routes, bridleways, a trim trail and an easier sculpture trail.
display_address: The Applegarth, Guisborough, Redcar and Cleveland, Tees Valley, England, TS14 6DJ, United Kingdom
